basics.name: Haizhou Yu
basics.label: B.S. Computer Engineering
basics.summary: I am a computer engineering student specializing in software development and embedded engineering. I also have vital interests, foundations, and experiences in the robotics, aerospace, automotive, and mechanics industries. I am keen to combine computer systems into those industries to create innovative products and solutions. I am also capable of multimedia production and am an independent music producer.

working experiences.name: Institute for Advanced Study, Princeton University
working experiences.summary: Teaching at Palmer Physical Laboratory (now 302 Frist Campus Center). While not a professor at Princeton, I associated with the physics professors and continued to give lectures on campus.

volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine

education.area: Embedded Engineering. Software Engineering, Hardware Engineering, System Engineering
courses: Data Structures and Algorithms, Computer Systems and Organizations, Cybersecurity, Embedded Software Development, Computer Architecture, Software Development, etc.

awards.title: Soong Ching Ling Scholarship - China's Only National Scholarship Award in the K-12 education system
awards.awarder: Ministry of Education of the People's Republic of China
awards.summary: Haizhou's excellence in diverse development across talent, academic and achievement was credited with the scholarship

researchs.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter Körper
researchs.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.

researchs.name: Über einen die Erzeugung und Verwandlung des Lichtes betreffenden heuristischen Gesichtspunkt
researchs.summary: In the second paper, he applied the quantum theory to light to explain the photoelectric effect. In particular, he used the idea of light quanta (photons) to explain experimental results, but stressed the importance of the experimental results. The importance of his work on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

researchs.name: Die Grundlage der allgemeinen Relativitätstheorie
researchs.summary: The publication of the theory of general relativity made him internationally famous. He was professor of physics at the universities of Zurich (1909–1911) and Prague (1911–1912), before he returned to ETH Zurich (1912–1914).

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
